TITLE: Georgia's parliament speaker signs divisive foreign influence bill into law
SUMMARY: A demonstrator argues with police officers during a protest against the foreign influence bill at the Parliamentary building in Tbilisi, Georgia, on Tuesday, May 28, 2024. The Georgian parliament has overridden a presidential veto of the "foreign agents" legislation that has fueled Western concerns and sparked massive protests for weeks

TITLE: Reflections on war past and present permeate D-Day's 80th anniversary
SUMMARY: Enthusiasts wearing replica World War II military attire ride atop a WWII-era military truck in Saint-Côme-du-Mont, northwestern France, on Tuesday, as part of the D-Day commemorations marking the 80th anniversary of the World War II Allied landings in Normandy. The D-Day ceremonies on June 6 this year mark the 80th anniversary. Miguel Medina/AFP via Getty Images

SUMMARY: Amanda Knox arrives flanked by her husband Christopher Robinson, right, at the Florence courtroom in Florence, Italy, on Wednesday

Jonathan Braga (left), Commanding General of U.S. Army Special Operations, greets World War II veteran Kenneth Smith, who served as a Petty Officer aboard the USS Satterlee off the coast of Normandy, following a ceremony honoring the U.S. Army Rangers who risked and lost their lives 80 years ago on D-Day in Pointe du Hoc, France on Tuesday

TITLE: Slovakia's Fico says his views on Ukraine were behind his assassination attempt
SUMMARY: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico is seen here at a roundtable meeting at an EU summit in Brussels, in February 2024. Fico has been released from the hospital where he was treated after an assassination attempt on May 15

TITLE: Russian propaganda in 2024 includes deepfakes, sham websites and social media swarms
SUMMARY: Russian navy recruits perform with the Russian flag in St. Petersburg, Russia, on June 4 during a ceremony marking the departure of recruits to join the army. In a year filled with elections around the world, Russia has stepped up its overt and covert propaganda efforts with a goal of weakening international support for Ukraine and undermining democratic institutions. Olga Maltseva/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: They were there on D-Day, on the beaches and in the skies. This is what they saw
SUMMARY: American soldiers huddle inside a landing craft approaching Utah Beach during the Allied invasion of Normandy, France, on D-Day. U.S. Army Photo/AFP via Getty Images

SUMMARY: Christophe Receveur, of France, unfurls an American flag he bought six months ago in Gettysburg, Pa., to mark D-Day on Thursday on Utah Beach, Normandy

TITLE: French left coalition comes out on top in elections, in shock upset over the far right
SUMMARY: Participants gather during an election night rally following the first results of the second round of France's legislative election at Place de la Republique in Paris on Sunday. Emmanuel Dunand/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: A Russian court has ordered the arrest of Alexei Navalny's widow, who lives abroad
SUMMARY: Yulia Navalnaya, widow of Alexei Navalny, walks away from his picture after lighting a candle at the end of a service in St. Mary's Church for the deceased Russian opposition politician Navalny on his birthday on June 4 in Berlin. Sebastian Gollnow/picture alliance via Getty Images

TITLE: Russia strikes a children's hospital in Kyiv and other sites across Ukraine
SUMMARY: Emergency workers respond at the Okhmatdyt children's hospital hit by Russian missiles, in Kyiv, Ukraine, Monday

SUMMARY: Heads of state pose for a group photo during the NATO 75th anniversary celebratory event at the Andrew Mellon Auditorium in Washington D.C. (July 9, 2024

TITLE: How these Ukrainian artists are using their talents to support the war effort
SUMMARY: Neak, a 43-year-old Ukrainian graffiti artist, mixes green paint at a workshop in Kyiv, Ukraine. His ETC graffiti crew works to camouflage cars to be sent east to the front line of the war with Russia

TITLE: This U.S. company is helping arm Ukraine against Russia — with AI drones
SUMMARY: Palmer Luckey, 31, founder of Anduril Industries, stands in front of the Dive-LD, an autonomous underwater drone at company headquarters in Costa Mesa, Calif. Anduril recently won a U.S. Navy contract to build 200 of them annually. Philip Cheung for NPR/NPR

TITLE: Treason and espionage cases are rising in Russia since the war in Ukraine began
SUMMARY: Ksenia Karelina, also known by the last name of Khavana, sits in a defendant’s cage in a court in Yekaterinburg, Russia, on June 20, 2024. The dual Russian-U.S. citizen was arrested on treason charges in Yekaterinburg in February after returning from Los Angeles to visit relatives. The charges reportedly stem from her $51 donation to a U.S. charity that helps Ukraine

TITLE: Ukrainian startups are creating a low-cost robot army to fight Russia
SUMMARY: Andrii Denysenko, CEO of design and production bureau "UkrPrototyp," stands by Odyssey, an 800-kilogram (1,750-pound) ground drone prototype, at a cornfield in northern Ukraine on June 28, 2024. Facing manpower shortages and uneven international assistance, Ukraine is counting heavily on innovation at home to halt Russia’s incremental but pounding advance in the east

TITLE: Copenhagen begins offering free perks to tourists who make sustainable choices
SUMMARY: Tourists visit Nyhavn, the 17th-century waterfront, in Copenhagen, Denmark, in this 2021 file photo. Jonathan Nackstrand/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Paris mayor swims in the Seine to demonstrate its safety ahead of the Olympics
SUMMARY: People jump into the Seine River in Paris on July 17, after Mayor Anne Hidalgo swam in the river to demonstrate that it is clean enough to host the outdoor swimming events at the Paris Olympics later this month. Julien De Rosa/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Paris police are sealing off the Seine River ahead of the Olympics opening ceremony
SUMMARY: Soldiers patrol on a footbridge over the Seine River on Wednesday in Paris

TITLE: Ukraine's bookstores are thriving, but a top printing plant took a deadly hit
SUMMARY: Scenes of destruction at the Factor Druk printing house, one of Ukraine's largest, can be seen days after it was hit in a Russian missile attack on May 27. Laurel Chor for NPR

SUMMARY: Opposition candidate Edmundo González Urrutia and party leader María Corina Machado wave to supporters in Las Mercedes on July 25, during their closing campaign event. Lexi Parra for NPR

TITLE: France's high-speed train lines are sabotaged hours before Olympic opening ceremony
SUMMARY: Travelers sit on stairs at the Gare de Montparnasse at the 2024 Summer Olympics on Friday in Paris. Hours away from the opening ceremony of the Olympics, high-speed rail traffic to the French capital was severely disrupted on Friday following what officials described as "criminal actions" and sabotage

TITLE: A 3rd child dies after the stabbing rampage at a dance class in England
SUMMARY: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer (center) carries a floral tribute on Tuesday near the scene of a deadly knife attack at a dance school a day earlier in Southport, England. James Speakman/PA via AP

TITLE: Djokovic and Nadal treat Olympic fans to a scintillating, if short, match in Paris
SUMMARY: Serbia's Novak Djokovic, right, shakes hands with Spain's Rafael Nadal after the two faced off in the Paris Olympics — their 60th matchup overall. Nadal has been battling injuries for years, but he rallied for a number of dramatic points in front of an appreciative crowd at Court Philippe-Chatrier at the Roland-Garros Stadium. Martin Mernetti/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Washington Post CEO accused in court of deceiving police about U.K. hacking scandal
SUMMARY: Will Lewis, shown here in newsroom, was a top executive for Rupert Murdoch's British publishing wing 13 years ago. He is accused of deceiving police about why the company destroyed evidence during an investigation of phone hacking by Murdoch's papers. Marvin Joseph/The Washington Post via Getty Images

TITLE: Ozempic's biggest side effect: Turning Denmark into a 'pharmastate'?
SUMMARY: In this photo illustration, boxes of the diabetes drug Ozempic rest on a pharmacy counter on April 17, 2023, in Los Angeles. Ozempic was originally approved by the Food and Drug Administration to treat people with Type 2 diabetes, and it's now also used by many people to lose weight

TITLE: U.K. police reviewing accusations against 'Washington Post' publisher
SUMMARY: Scotland Yard is reviewing allegations against the Washington Post's publisher and CEO, Will Lewis, shown here at a conference in 2017. The preliminary inquiry centers on Lewis' actions while an executive for Rupert Murdoch's British newspaper company

TITLE: Report: Ukraine receives first batch of U.S.-made F-16 fighter jets
SUMMARY: FILE - An F-16 fighter lands at a Turkish air base in the Central Anatolian Turkish city of Konya on Sept. 8, 2004. Norway said Wednesday, July 10, 2024, it will donate six F-16 in the course of 2024 to Ukraine because Kyiv's “ability to defend itself against attacks from the air is absolutely crucial in its defensive battle against Russia

TITLE: The Sycamore Gap tree is regenerating itself, delighting experts
SUMMARY: New shoots have appeared at the base of the stump of the Sycamore Gap tree
